intro: Epilobium × lloydii, commonly known as the hybrid willow herb, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in streambanks and wet meadows. Epilobium × lloydii is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting pollinators.
